main event: On May 3, 1959, a ground-visual UFO observation was reported, lasting 60 seconds. The bright object was believed to be a white blue meteor or flare, leaving a red gas wake for almost 20 minutes.
interesting points: The observation was classified as a ground-visual type with no photographs available.
The observer noted a great similarity between the observed object and a white blue meteor or flare.
A red gas wake remained for almost 20 minutes after the observation, indicating a persistent trail left by the object.
The conclusion of the report stated that the observer believed the object to be a meteor, leading to the case being closed.
Additional information was received from the M/V Rio de Laplata/LPOB, describing a similar bright object, likely a white blue meteor, with great intensity and a northwest course.
sighted object: Bright object, believed to be a white blue meteor or flare
